title: The definition namespace for security settings pertaining to a Nox solution.
description: Define security settings pertinent to a Nox solution here. These may include secrets among other.

secrets.title: The definition namespace for secrets used in a Nox solution.
secrets.description: Specify properties pertinent to secrets as configured within a Nox solution here. Examples include servers and validity period.

organizationSecretsServer.title: The definition namespace for the secrets server used in a Nox solution.
organizationSecretsServer.description: Specify properties pertinent to the secrets server here. Examples include name, serverUri, Port, connection credentials and provider

provider.title: The secrets server provider.
provider.description: The provider used for this secrets server. Examples include AzureKeyVault, AwsKeyManagementService and HashicorpVault.

validFor.title: The definition namespace for the validity period of secrets as defined in a Nox solution.
validFor.description: Specify the validity period of secrets pertaining to the solution here. Possible units of measure include days, hours, minutes and seconds.

name.title: The unique name of this server component in the solution.
name.description: The name of this server component in the solution. The name must be unique in the solution configuration

serverUri.title: Hostname, IP address or URI.
serverUri.description: The name, address, URI or IP of the server to connect to.

user.title: Username.
user.description: The username to use when connecting to this server.

password.title: Password.
password.description: The password to use when connecting to this server.

options.title: Additional options.
options.description: A list of additional options to set when connecting to this server.

solutionSecretsServer.title: The definition namespace for the secrets server used in a Nox solution.
solutionSecretsServer.description: Specify properties pertinent to the secrets server here. Examples include name, serverUri, Port, connection credentials and provider

provider.title: The secrets server provider.
provider.description: The provider used for this secrets server. Examples include AzureKeyVault, AwsKeyManagementService and HashicorpVault.

validFor.title: The definition namespace for the validity period of secrets as defined in a Nox solution.
validFor.description: Specify the validity period of secrets pertaining to the solution here. Possible units of measure include days, hours, minutes and seconds.

name.title: The unique name of this server component in the solution.
name.description: The name of this server component in the solution. The name must be unique in the solution configuration

serverUri.title: Hostname, IP address or URI.
serverUri.description: The name, address, URI or IP of the server to connect to.

user.title: Username.
user.description: The username to use when connecting to this server.

password.title: Password.
password.description: The password to use when connecting to this server.

options.title: Additional options.
options.description: A list of additional options to set when connecting to this server.

userIdentity.title: Configuration for the end-user identity provider.
userIdentity.description: Specify the settings required to authenticate the application to the end-user identity provider.

azureAdOptions.title: The options to connect to the Azure AD identity provider.
azureAdOptions.description: Specify the properties required to connect the application with the Azure AD identity provider. See https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/api-management/api-management-howto-protect-backend-with-aad

instance.title: The URL of the Azure AD instance.
instance.description: The URL of the Azure AD instance that your application should use for authentication. It typically has a format like https://login.microsoftonline.com/.

domain.title: The domain name associated with your Azure AD tenant.
domain.description: Used to define the domain name associated with your Azure AD tenant.

tenantId.title: The GUID that uniquely identifies your Azure AD tenant.
tenantId.description: The GUID that uniquely identifies your Azure AD tenant. It's sometimes referred to as the Directory ID.

clientId.title: The Application ID of your registered application in Azure AD.
clientId.description: The Application ID of your registered application in Azure AD. The application ID is used to identify your application when it communicates with Azure AD.

callbackPath.title: The URL path where Azure AD should redirect users after sign-in.
callbackPath.description: The URL path that Azure AD should redirect users to after they have signed in. It's often set to something like /signin-oidc.

signedOutCallbackPath.title: The URL path where Azure AD should redirect users after sign-out.
signedOutCallbackPath.description: the URL path to which Azure AD should redirect users after they have signed out from the application. This callback path is used to handle post-sign-out actions and provide a seamless user experience during the sign-out process.
